availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Zachariah W. Owens (Clark County, Kentucky, farm laborer and lieutenant)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Horatio Owen and Martha Owen. Married to Frances Owen. Father of Sarah M. Owen and Isabel Owen. Employed as laborer for Horatio Owen in Clark County in 1850. Served as second lieutenant in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry from August 1, 1862, to September 16, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 18A-B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Precinct 5, p. 109A-B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 377.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 940.
Find A Grave, "Zachariah W. Owen (1835-1882)," Memorial #88997994, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88997994 (accessed March 1, 2019).
